alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 1:26PM CST until March 03 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CST FOR EASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTY... At 126 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Gaylesville to near Moshat to near Ball Flat, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Forney, Gaylesville, Tennala, Pleasant Gap, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Ball Flat, Western Weiss Lake, Coloma, Fullerton, Spring Garden, Broomtown, Howells Crossroads and Waterhouse. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CST for northeastern and east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
